Module count
Package count.gui.kit

Interface PointIcon

All Superinterfaces:
Icon, Shape
All Known Implementing Classes:
BoxIcon, DiamondIcon, DiscIcon
public interface PointIcon
extends Shape, Icon
Display style for a point. A point (like in a scatterplot) can be displayed by using any shape. Must be able to handle filled or unfilled points (diamonds, boxes, ...)
Since:
November 14, 2007, 12:21 AM
Author:
Miklós Csűrös csurosm@gmail.com

  • Method Details

    • setSize

      void setSize​(int point_size)
      Sets the size of this point display.
      Parameters:
      point_size - radius of the circle in which this guy has to fit.

    • setDrawColor

      void setDrawColor​(Color c)
      Sets the preferred Color used for drawing the outline.
      Parameters:
      c - if null, then default values are used.

    • setFillColor

      void setFillColor​(Color c)
      Sets the preferred Color used for the inside of filled points.
      Parameters:
      c - if null, then default values are used.

    • getFillColor

      Color getFillColor()

    • setFilled

      void setFilled​(boolean is_filled)
      Sets the filling attribute.
      Parameters:
      is_filled - new value for whether this is filled

    • paint

      void paint​(Graphics g, int x, int y, Color draw_color, Color fill_color)
      Paints a point at the given location with the given colors. (Does not change the drawing color of the graphics context.)
      Parameters:
      g - graphics context
      x - X coordinate of the center.
      y - Y coordinate of the center.
      draw_color - Color used for the outline: if null, then no outline.
      fill_color - Color used for the inside: if null, then no filling.

    • paint

      void paint​(Graphics g, int x, int y)
      Paints a point at the given location with the given colors. Drawing and filling colors are determined by the values set for this style - if none, then defaults are taken from the graphics context.
      Parameters:
      g - graphics context
      x - X coordinate of the center.
      y - Y coordinate of the center.
